IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE KEY DECISION MAKERS WITH UNBIASED RESEARCH & CONSTRUCTIVE SOLUTIONS (SEE PART III)
IRS990.MissionDesc: MASSACHUSETTS TAXPAYERS FOUNDATION PROVIDES PUBLIC & PRIVATE SECTOR DECISION MAKERS WITH ACCURATE, TIMELY, UNBIASED RESEARCH & CONSTRUCTIVE SOLUTIONS THAT DRIVE PUBLIC POLICY IN ORDER TO STRENGTHEN THE STATE'S FINANCES & POSITION THE COMMONWEALTH FOR LONG-TERM GROWTH.
IRS990.Desc: ANALYSIS OF THE STATE BUDGET:PERFORMED RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS, RELEASED PUBLICATIONS AND WORKED FOR REFORM ON A WIDE RANGE OF ISSUES AFFECTING THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS INCLUDING HEALTH CARE, BUSINESS COSTS AND TRANSPORTATION FUNDING TO TAX COMPETITIVENESS, CAPITAL INVESTMENTS AND STATE AND LOCAL FINANCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ANNUAL TAX CONFERENCE WITH TAX PRACTITIONERS AND GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS TO DISCUSS MASSACHUSETTS STATE AND LOCAL TAXES.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: RIGHT OF USE ASSET - OPERATING LEASE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, OF WHICH THERE WAS NONE FOR THE YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2021 AND 2020, WOULD BE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. CONSEQUENTLY, THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT REFLECT ANY PROVISIONS FOR INCOME TAXES.

FundraiserActivityInfoGrp.ActivityTxt: PROVIDES CONSULTING FOR SECURING SPONSORSHIPS FOR MTFS 90TH

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ON BEHALF OF THE FULL GOVERNING BODY, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON MUST DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION AT THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING, BUT AFTER THE PRESENTATION, HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE MEETING DURING THE DISCUSSION OF, AND THE VOTE ON, THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT INVOLVING THE POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE SHALL, IF APPROPRIATE, APPOINT A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE ALTERNATIVES TO THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE SHALL BE COMPOSED ENTIRELY OF NONMEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE. AFTER EXERCISING DUE DILIGENCE, THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER THE ORGANIZATION CAN OBTAIN WITH REASONABLE EFFORTS A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT FROM A PERSON OR ENTITY THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION IS NOT REASONABLY POSSIBLE UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES NOT PRODUCING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BEST INTEREST, FOR ITS OWN BENEFIT, AND WHETHER IT IS FAIR AND REASONABLE. IN CONFIRMITY WITH THE ABOVE DETERMINATION IT SHALL MAKE ITS DECISION AS TO WHETHER TO ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. EACH TRUSTEE, PRINCIPAL OFFICER AND MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS SHALL ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS SUCH PERSON: A. HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTERESTS POLICY, B. HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, C. HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY, AND D. UNDERSTANDS MTF IS CHARITABLE AND IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE FOUNDATION'S PRESIDENT IS DETERMINED BY INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEES UTILIZE INDEPENDENT, THIRD-PARTY ADVISORS, CONSULTANTS, AND COUNSEL TO CONDUCT PERIODIC COMPENSATION STUDIES. THE COMPENSATION STUDY ENCOMPASSES COMPARABLE, RELEVANT MARKET DATA FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S POSITIONS OBTAINED FROM PUBLISHED SURVEYS, AND OTHER AVAILABLE SOURCES SUCH AS PEER ORGANIZATIONS' 990 FORMS. OTHER SURVEYS OF SPECIALIZED SKILL SET OR EMPLOYEE ATTRIBUTES CRITICAL TO THE SUCCESS OF THE ORGANIZATION WILL ALSO BE INCORPORATED AS NEEDED. THE MOST RECENT COMPENSATION STUDY PRESENTED TO THE COMMITTEES WAS IN 2014. ALL COMPENSATION DECISIONS MADE ARE APPROVED AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET APPROVAL PROCESS AND DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES. COMPENSATION FOR OTHERS WAS DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA ESTABLISHED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT CHANGE EITHER ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.
